Dear Mack McGhee:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer, at 517-899-6024.
Sincerely,
Vivian D Malleck, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 4/9/25, a staff member slapped a youth across the face and
told the youth to do as they were told. The youth did not want to
go into a shower with other youth due to the youth threatening to
jump him. The staff member told the youth that they are tired of
the youth's refusal to do things. The staff member stated that no
one would do anything if they slapped the youth.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 04/10/2025 by phone.
Complainant did not have additional information. Complainant was
informed that Wayne County Juvenile Detention has individual
shower stalls with shower doors that are secured from the outside
with approximately a 20-inch open clearance between the floor
and the bottom of the door.
Youth A was interviewed on 04/11/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with Wayne County Juvenile Detention’s in-
house Special Investigation Unit Investigator. Youth A stated a
female staff (does not know her name) told him to shower first but
he wanted to shower last. Youth A stated Staff 1 walked up to him,
“smacked” him and said, “You need to start listening”. Youth A
was asked where this incident took place. Youth A stated Staff 1
opened the shower stall door and “smacked” the right side of his
face and then left. Youth A stated he showered, exited the shower
stall and called his mother. Youth A stated Staff 1 told him he was
military bound and could do whatever he wanted without
consequence. Youth A stated the right side of his face was sore to
the touch when asked if he was injured. Youth A’s face was
observed without swelling or marks. Youth A stated the right side
of his face was never bruised or swollen from this incident. Youth
A stated there were no witnesses to this incident.
2

Staff 1 was interviewed on 04/17/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Staff 1 stated Youth A was upset that he could not call
his mother due to shower time. Staff 1 stated he redirected Youth
A to take a shower and told him that he could call his mother after
shower time. Staff 1 stated Staff 2 also redirected Youth A to take
a shower, or she would document it as a refusal. Staff 1 stated
Youth A picked up his clean clothes and towel from the table and
went into the shower stall crying. Staff 1 stated he knocked on the
shower door and asked if Youth A was dressed before opening it.
Staff 1 stated he reassured Youth A that after shower time he
could call his mother, hung Youth A’s clean clothes on the shower
stall door and closed the door. Staff 1 stated Youth A showered,
came out and immediately asked for a phone call. Staff 1 stated
Youth A was redirected and made a phone call when shower time
was completed. Staff 1 denied hitting or slapping Youth A in this
incident. Staff 1 denied stating to Youth A or any youth that his
military standing excuses him from consequences.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 04/24/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Staff 2 stated she directed Youth A to take a shower,
and he refused without explanation. Staff 2 stated Staff 1
redirected Youth A to shower and walked with him to the shower
area to pick up clean clothes and towel. Staff 2 stated she did not
hear or see Staff 1 slap Youth A.
Video
04/09/2025 Unit 1A video was reviewed. It shows at 7:24 PM
Youth A collects his clean towel and clothes from a table. Youth A
enters a shower stall and the shower stall door closes. Staff 1 taps
and opens the shower door and hangs white items (believed to be
towels and underwear) on top of the shower stall door. Staff 1
steps away the shower stall door and it closes. Youth A walks out
of the shower stall fully dressed. The video does not show Staff 1
moving or raising his arm in a slapping motion, stepping forward
or entering the shower.
Tour
Upon entering Unit 1A the two individual shower stalls are to the
left. Tables with attached stools are in front of the shower stall
area.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance of staff not hitting or striking,
throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing Youth A on any part of his
body on 04/09/2025. Staff 1 and Staff 2’s interview and video
3

review do not support the allegation that Staff 1 slapped Youth A
in the face.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for
the continual needs, protection and supervision of residents.
Allegation Additional Allegation
Investigation Interviews
Youth A was interviewed on 04/11/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth A alleged Youth B ran up and placed
him in a headlock in the main gym on the third floor. Youth A
stated a female staff (does not know her name) redirected Youth
B to let Youth A go and not be around Youth A. Youth A stated he
gagged in the headlock but was not injured. Youth A was not
observed with marks around his neck. Youth A stated this incident
occurred on 04/10/2025.
Youth B was interviewed on 04/17/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth B stated he knows Youth A. Youth B
stated he never placed Youth A in a headlock in a horseplay
incident or during a physical altercation.
Deputy Director’s email dated 04/30/2025 states Staff 3 and
Staff 4 were assigned to Unit 1A (Youth A’s unit) and took Unit 1A
youths to the main gym on 04/10/2025.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 05/08/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with their in-house Special Investigation Unit
Investigator. Staff 3 stated she does not recall Youth A but does
know Youth B. Staff 3 stated she does not recall witnessing Youth
B horseplaying and placing a youth in a headlock. Staff 3 was
asked how she would respond to horseplaying. Staff 3 stated she
would redirect the youths and separate them.
4

Staff 4 was interviewed on 05/08/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Staff 4 stated he does not recall Youth A or Youth B
because he typically works midnight shift and the youths are
asleep. Staff 4 stated most of the youths horseplay and require
redirection to stop horseplaying when he worked morning or
afternoon shift.
Video
Wayne County Juvenile Detention’s main gym 04/10/2025 video
was reviewed. It shows at 11:13 AM Youth A shadow boxing by
himself while several youths sit at a nearby table playing cards.
Youth B approaches Youth A and they shadow box together.
Youth B and Youth A stand face to face and Youth B wraps his
right arm around Youth A’s neck for several seconds. Staff 3, who
stands nearby, gestures to Youth A and Youth B and appears to
verbally redirect them. Youth B releases Youth A, who is laughing,
and walks away. Video footage does not have sound.
Documentation
Wayne County Juvenile Detention Code of Ethics policy and
procedure 3.1 states staff may not horseplay with youth. It does
not have a policy and procedure about youth-on-youth horseplay.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance for providing the needs,
protection and supervision of Youth A. Video shows Staff 1
monitoring Youth A and Youth B and appears to redirect their
horseplaying. The video also shows Youth A laughing when Youth
B releases him.
CONSULTATION
It is recommended that Wayne County Juvenile Detention have a
policy and procedure regarding youth-on-youth horseplay.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
Rule Code Program Statement.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
5

Allegation Additional Allegations 1 and 2
Investigation Interviews
Additional allegation 1
Youth A’s Foster Care Worker (FCW) stated in a 04/21/2025
email that she was unable to reach Department Supervisor on
04/10/2025 to schedule Youth A’s wellness check. Youth A’s FCW
stated she left a message on 04/10/2025 and provided the
telephone number used.
Department Supervisor was interviewed on 04/29/2025 by
phone. This consultant called the telephone number provided by
Youth A’s FCW and reached Department Supervisor on the first
try. Department Supervisor stated she was not at work on
04/10/2025. Department Supervisor stated she follows up on
messages upon her return from off-days. Department Supervisor
could not determine if Youth A’s Foster Care Worker left her a
message on 04/10/2025 and if she followed up upon her return.
Department Supervisor stated she did not know what happens
when a foster care worker has an emergency need and she is not
working.
Deputy Director was interviewed on 05/01/2025 at Wayne
County Juvenile Detention. Deputy Director stated Department
Supervisor is to forward calls to him when she is not working. It
was requested for Deputy Director to follow up with Department
Supervisor on the expected out-of-office procedure.
Allegation 2
Complainant was interviewed on 04/10/2025 by phone.
Complainant alleged she made approximately 40 phone calls on
04/09/2025 to Wayne County Juvenile Detention and Detroit
Police and finally to Central Intake to ensure Youth A was safe at
Wayne County Juvenile Detention. Complainant stated she was
unable to reach a live person at Wayne County Juvenile Detention
and left numerous messages on 04/09/2025. Complainant
provided the two numbers she called to reach someone at Wayne
County Juvenile Detention.
Deputy Director was interviewed on 04/24/2025 at Wayne
County Juvenile Detention. Deputy Director stated the two
numbers called by the Complainant are unknown. The correct
number was received and not provided to Complainant because
Youth A was discharged on 04/12/2025.
6

Analysis Allegation 1
The agency is found in noncompliance because Department
Supervisor does not have an established out-of-office procedure
in handling foster care worker calls when she is off except to
return calls upon her return.
Allegation 2
The agency is found in compliance because Complainant did not
call the correct number.
Conclusion Allegation 1 – REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
